p: Beginning in 2015, ZIKV emerged and spread with extreme intensity throughout the Americas. Between 2015–2016 laboratory-confirmed and suspected cases were reported from 87 countries and territories worldwide, with over 750 000 cases reported from the Americas alone [ 53, 54]. Autochthonous ZIKV transmission was reported in southern Florida, France, and Argentina—regions at the edge of the historical range of arbovirus transmission [ 53].
